title: Alex To
text:
Alex To (born Alejandro Delfino on 10 February 1962) is a <a href="Hong%20Kong">Hong Kong</a>- and <a href="Taiwan">Taiwan</a>-based singer and actor. He is the winner of the 4th annual <a href="New%20Talent%20Singing%20Awards">New Talent Singing Awards</a> in 1985. He has released numerous albums throughout his career and mainly has <a href="R%26amp%3BB">R&B</a> influenced songs.
Biography.
Early life and career.
Alex To was born and raised in Hong Kong to a Filipino singer father Ollie Delfino and the Chinese singer <a href="Zhang%20Lu%20%28singer%29">Chang Loo</a>. To's mother had emigrated from Shanghai in 1952 after the <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20China">communists</a> had outlawed popular music. In 1980, at the age of 18, he studied abroad in <a href="Vancouver">Vancouver, British Columbia</a>, Canada majoring in commercial design. In 1985, at age 23, he graduated from university and worked as an <a href="Art%20Director">Art Director</a> back in Hong Kong. That same year, he entered the 4th annual <a href="New%20Talent%20Singing%20Awards">New Talent Singing Awards</a> and won first place (the Gold Award). He was then signed to <a href="Capital%20Artists">Capital Artists</a> and began his career in the music industry. His debut <a href="Standard%20Cantonese">Cantonese</a> album "只想留下" was released in 1986. His first <a href="Standard%20Mandarin">Mandarin</a> album "談情說愛" was released in 1990 in <a href="Taiwan">Taiwan</a>.
In 1987, he also met and spent time with Michael Jackson during his visit to Hong Kong. After 2009, Alex paid for 1:1 copper statute of Michael and placed in Shan Yuan Temple, located in <a href="Tuen%20Mun">Tuen Mun</a>, Hong Kong, it still exists.
He married Ice Li (李晓冰) on 11 November 2012 and had their son, AJ on 2016.
